comments:
I wannted to Debug my program.
It's Possible to run the program in elipse with the run Button. But if I press
the "Debug" Button the Enclipse Environment switches to the "Debug Perspective"
( so far so good ) and the following message appears:

< Error Message >
Exception occured during launch
Reason:
Failed Launching CDI Debugger : Error initializing: Timeout 
</ ErrorMessage >

If I close Eclipse, start Eclipse again and press the "Debug" Button without
pressing the "Run" Button before I get another Error Message: 

< Error Message >
Failed Launching CDI Debugger : Error initializing: {R,T}xThread terminated
</ Error Message >

You can see it at the top of the second session ("Log Sessions" at the End of
this  mail)

When I wanted to verify if I get the same Error Message if i do the same steps
as described a few lines above (reopen elipse / press "Debug" Button first)
I get a new Error message:

< Error Message >
Failed Launching CDI Debugger : Error initializing: Interpreter `mi1'
</ Error Message >

I tried two more times but now get the same Error Message as describe above

Here is some Information about my System:
I'm using Suse Linux 7.3
kernel version 2.4.20

For my Eclipse Installation, i installed the following files:

eclipse-SDK-RC1-linux-gtk.zip
org.eclipse.cdt-200212181139-linux-gtk_1.0.1.bin.dist.zip
org.eclipse.cdt-linux-gtk_1.0.1.bin.dist.zip
atk-1.2.0.tar.bz2
pango-1.0.5.tar.bz2
pango-1.2.1.tar.bz2
glib-2.2.1.tar.bz2
gtk+-2.2.1.tar.bz2
pkgconfig-0.14.0.tar.gz
tiff-v3.5.7.tar.gz
jpegsrc.v6b.tar.gz
libpng-1.2.5.tar.gz
j2sdk-1_4_1_01-linux-i586-rpm.bin
j2sdk-1_4_1-doc.zip                

I installed the above mentioned file
"org.eclipse.cdt-200212181139-linux-gtk_1.0.1.bin.dist.zip"
after i recognized that in the install configuration of the 
"Eclipse C/C++ Development Tools 1.0.1" was somthing wrong. When i viewed the
"Detail" from "Show Status" menu, i get the information, that the feature is not
 properly configured. After installing the File this mistake was gone.
But my main error described at the top unfortunately stays.

Good Luck finding the error.

You need a gdb version starting from
gdb-5.2.1.

The 5.2.1 version will do nicely.

As the long is pointing, "mi1" not recognize.

We use the MI level 1 protocol to exchange with gdb
I will close in few weeks if no feedback.

Sorry for late feedback and many thanks for your help!
Your tip with using the gdb debugger with at least version 5.2.1 worked fine.
After installing the newest version of gdb i was able to debugg in Eclipse( RC1
) for a time. Later I get new problems because debugging crashes. So I decided
to use DDD for debugging my program. And use Eclipse for the rest but I got new
Problems where eclipse was freezing in. Reported in Bug
http://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=33836 
But since using Eclipse( RC2 ) all Problems are gone. Up to now no new errors
occured in this version.

> Your tip with using the gdb debugger with at least version 5.2.1 worked fine.

Great!

> Later I get new problems because debugging crashes. So I decided
> to use DDD for debugging my program.

8-), true DDD is much more mature and does not rely on the new protocol
from gdb (gdb/MI) which was causing us much problems.
But please, keep the bugs report comming 8), it is the only way to get better.

> And use Eclipse for the rest but I got new
> Problems where eclipse was freezing in. Reported in Bug
> http://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=33836 
> But since using Eclipse( RC2 ) all Problems are gone. Up to now no new errors
> occured in this version.

Cool PR close.
